abstract: A source of live data about the device pose and anchors in a person’s surroundings.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/ARKit/WorldTrackingProvider

# WorldTrackingProvider

**Class**

A source of live data about the device pose and anchors in a person’s surroundings.

## Declaration

```swift
final class WorldTrackingProvider
```

## Tracking objects

- **init()**: Creates a world-tracking provider.
- **anchorUpdates**: A sequence of updates to anchors a provider tracks.
- **requiredAuthorizations**: The types of authorizations necessary for tracking world anchors.
- **isSupported**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the current runtime environment supports world-tracking providers.
- **allAnchors**: An array of all known world anchors from the world-tracking provider.
- **addAnchor(_:)**: Adds a world anchor you supply to the set of currently tracked anchors.
- **WorldTrackingProvider.Error**: An error that can occur during a world-tracking session.

## Stopping object tracking

- **removeAnchor(_:)**: Removes a world anchor from a world-tracking provider.
- **removeAnchor(forID:)**: Removes a world anchor from a world-tracking provider based on its ID.

## Predicting device pose

- **queryDeviceAnchor(atTimestamp:)**: The predicted pose of the current device at a given time.

## Inspecting a world-tracking provider

- **state**: The current status of data coming from a provider.
- **description**: A textual description of a world-tracking provider.

## Instance Properties

- **worldAnchorSharingAvailability**: A sequence of world anchor sharing availability changes.

## Instance Methods

- **removeAllAnchors()**: Removes all known world anchors from world tracking.

## Enumerations

- **WorldTrackingProvider.WorldAnchorSharingAvailability**: Enumeration indicating the availability of world anchor sharing.

## World tracking

- **Tracking specific points in world space**: Retrieve the position and orientation of anchors your app stores in ARKit.
- **WorldAnchor**: A fixed location in a person’s surroundings.
- **DeviceAnchor**: The position and orientation of Apple Vision Pro.

## Conforms To

- CustomStringConvertible
- DataProvider
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
